name: himation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a piece of clothing worn by people in ancient Greece, consisting of a rectangular cloth wrapped over the left shoulder and around the body: The hall was lined with sculptures of ancient thinkers wearing himations, including the poet Homer and the philosopher Aristotle.
More examplesFewer examplesThe himation was usually worn by Greek men and women as a cloak or shawl over another garment, especially in colder months.The painting showed several figures clad in himations walking around the agora.
